column4: I am having a hal problem, when I login to gnome, I get a "Failed to initialize HAL" erro, then I have to kill dbus-daemon-1 to get gnome to fully come up. Then I have about 20 20-hal.hotplug running and about the same 10-hal.dev
when I try killing a bunch of the hotplugs, I get a kill process in zombie status
have you tried with a fresh user?
tried reinstalling ubuntu alltogether last night
definitely file a bug, even if you can fix it
i won't be able to fix it, but better people will :)
literally don't have a clue, how long has the bug been filed?
week and a half or so
I will paste you the bug link
I found something somewhere that said that I could put a line in my grub kernel params to fix it
but when I do that I get an error on start up about failed to find ide-mod module
so I don't think that that is even working
